hello, having problems with my dvd player recognizing dvd medium that's inserted in the tray, plays cds fine.  Any help??
what media are you trying to work with?  video dvd's?  data dvd's?
if so... have you installed libdvdcss2?  it's a library that allows you to decrypt retail DVD's...

yeah that's weird... it sounds like drive issue?
that would be my assumption.  yeah... when you insert the disk... look at /var/log/syslog and /var/log/messages
it will give you info about read errors... or other useful info...
is there something in particular i can grep.. i'm not sure what to do with all the information in that output
sorry mate.  yeah... just do a tail -f /var/log/syslog  and in another terminal... tail -f /var/log/messages
so when you load the DVD in the drive... you should see messages that might mean something...
i only see a bunch of stuff about pcmcia & my wireless networks
yeah, then i'm not sure mate.
